title: metabolonIO
code: library("metabolonIO") #> Warning: replacing previous import 'S4Arrays::makeNindexFromArrayViewport' by #> 'DelayedArray::makeNindexFromArrayViewport' when loading 'SummarizedExperiment' suppressPackageStartupMessages({   library("macrophage")   library("SummarizedExperiment")   library("limma")   library("edgeR")   library("DESeq2") })

what: Path to example client data table.
title: metabolonIO
text: data saved package now, needed later. cdt path th e path Client data table, case took model client data table filled example data
code: cdt_path <- system.file("extdata", "example_data_tables.XLSX", package = "metabolonIO")  data(gse) rownames(gse) <- substr(rownames(gse), 1, 15) # per togliere tutto quello dopo il punto

title: metabolonIO
text: First step setting differential expression analysis using DESeq2 limma macrophage data included macrophage package example, data used show export metabolon.
code: dds <- DESeqDataSet(gse, design = ~condition) #> using counts and average transcript lengths from tximeta  keep <- rowSums(counts(dds) >= 10) >= 6 dds <- dds[keep, ]  dds <- DESeq(dds) #> estimating size factors #> using 'avgTxLength' from assays(dds), correcting for library size #> estimating dispersions #> gene-wise dispersion estimates #> mean-dispersion relationship #> final dispersion estimates #> fitting model and testing condition <- factor(colData(gse)[, "condition_name"])  design <- model.matrix(~ 0 + condition) colnames(design) <- levels(condition)  contrast.matrix <- makeContrasts(   IFNg_vs_naive = IFNg - naive,   levels = design )  d0 <- DGEList(assay(gse)) d0 <- calcNormFactors(d0)  cutoff <- 1 drop <- which(apply(cpm(d0), 1, max) < cutoff) d <- d0[-drop, ]  matrix_to_fit_model_to <- voom(d, design, plot = F) # matrix_to_fit_model_to <- assay(se) # Use the assay data from the SummarizedExperiment object  fit <- lmFit(matrix_to_fit_model_to, design) # fit2 <- contrasts.fit(fit, contrast.matrix)  # View(as.data.frame(colData(se))) fit2 <- eBayes(fit2) res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_dds <- results(dds,   contrast = c("condition", "IFNg", "naive"),   lfcThreshold = 1, alpha = 0.05 ) summary(res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_dds) #>  #> out of 17806 with nonzero total read count #> adjusted p-value < 0.05 #> LFC > 1.00 (up)    : 416, 2.3% #> LFC < -1.00 (down) : 141, 0.79% #> outliers [1]       : 95, 0.53% #> low counts [2]     : 0, 0% #> (mean count < 3) #> [1] see 'cooksCutoff' argument of ?results #> [2] see 'independentFiltering' argument of ?results res_macrophage_IFNg_vs_naive_limma <- topTable(fit2, coef = "IFNg_vs_naive", adjust = "fdr", number = Inf, confint = TRUE)

what: Converting SummarizedExperiment or DE results to Metabolon format
title: metabolonIO
text: requirement package work CLIENT_SAMPLE_ID colnames summarized experiment. can call two functions convert data format can uploaded Metabolon platform multiomics section. automatically formats different expression results format requested Metabolon. works DESeq2 limma results, can also provide custom data frame required columns. cdt argument path client data table file want use get sample metadata. addition can also convert assay data summarized experiment object format requested Metabolon using function se_to_metabolon. Important note: metabolon able run pathway analysis feature annotation must format requested . transcriptomics data recommended format ENSEMBL gene ids, proteomics data recommended format UNIPROT ids.

what: Converting DE results to Metabolon format
title: metabolonIO
text: package works also limma results using topTable format:

what: Converting Metabolon client data table to SummarizedExperiment
title: metabolonIO
text: central functionality ability convert Metabolon Client data table files SummarizedExperiment objects. can using function cdt_to_se, output SummarizedExperiment object can use analysis pipelines. automatically merges compound information subject metdata adds respectively rowData colData SummarizedExperiment object. can specify annotation type want use rownames SummarizedExperiment object using argument rowdata_key. Note: compounds specified annotation type removed final object, rownames duplicated empty. data_type argument allows select type data want load client data table. can also save output SummarizedExperiment object RDS file using output_file argument. set FALSE, object just returned without saving, output_file argument case course ignored. small trick: can convert SummarizedExperiment object SingleCellExperiment object able store additional information dimensionality reductions .
code: se <- cdt_to_se(   cdt = cdt_path,   output_file = "test/cdt_to_se_bni.rds",   save_file = F,   data_type = "batch_norm_imputed",   rowdata_key = "INCHIKEY" ) se #> class: SummarizedExperiment  #> dim: 6 24  #> metadata(0): #> assays(1): counts #> rownames(6): FAKEINCHIKEY00001 FAKEINCHIKEY00002 ... FAKEINCHIKEY00005 #>   FAKEINCHIKEY00006 #> rowData names(21): CHEM_ID LIB_ID ... PUBCHEM PLATFORM #> colnames(24): TEST-1 TEST-2 ... TEST-23 TEST-24 #> colData names(34): PARENT_SAMPLE_NAME CLIENT_IDENTIFIER ... TREATMENT #>   WT_KO library(SingleCellExperiment) #>  #> Attaching package: 'SingleCellExperiment' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:edgeR': #>  #>     cpm, tpm  sce <- as(se, "SingleCellExperiment")  # As you can see here we can add dimensionality reductions (as many as we need) to the object using the capabilities of a single cell summarized experiment pca_result <- prcomp(t(assay(se)))  reducedDim(sce, "PCA") <- pca_result$x

code: @Manual{,   title = {metabolonIO: Metabolon Interface},   author = {Edoardo Filippi},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.2.0},   url = {https://github.com/edo98811/metabolon_summarized_experiment}, }

title: Metabolon Interface
text: package developed interface standard bioinformatics pipelines metabolon software. can load metabolon data SummarizedExperiment object, common data structure used bioinformatics storing high-throughput assay data along associated metadata. Metabolon offers platform multiomics analysis. package also offers interface allowing export data required format. functions export data summarized experiment “counts” file can uploaded metabolon platform. Furthermore, results different standard bioinfomratics pipelines, example differential analysis using DESeq2 limma, can exported required format uploaded metabolon platform. results can also just data frame required columns. obrained tables can directly uploaded myMetabolon platform.

title: Metabolon Interface
text: https://github.com/edo98811/metabolon_summarized_experiment.git install package, can use remotes package R:
code: # Install the remotes package if you haven't already install.packages("remotes")  # Use remotes to install the package from GitHub remotes::install_github("edo98811/metabolon_summarized_experiment")

what: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
text: function reads CDT (Client Data Table) Excel file converts SummarizedExperiment object. function allows selecting specific data types optionally saves resulting object file.

title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
code: cdt_to_se(   cdt,   output_file = NULL,   save_file = T,   data_type = "batch_norm_imputed",   rowdata_key = "INCHIKEY" )

title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
text: cdt Character. Path CDT Excel file. Must exist. output_file Character. Path save resulting SummarizedExperiment object. NULL save_file TRUE, default filename generated. save_file Logical. Whether save resulting SummarizedExperiment object file. Default TRUE. FALSE, object returned. path provided, default filename generated based current date saved working directory. data_type Character. type data extract CDT file. Options : "peak_area": Extracts peak area data (sheet 4). "batch_norm": Extracts batch normalized data (sheet 5). "batch_norm_imputed": Extracts batch normalized imputed data (sheet 6). "mass_extracted": Extracts mass extracted data (sheet 7). "log_transformed": Extracts log-transformed data (sheet 8). Default "batch_norm_imputed". rowdata_key Character. column name row data (sheet 2) use row names.

title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
text: SummarizedExperiment object containing: assays: assay data extracted CDT file. rowData: Metadata rows (e.g., compounds). colData: Metadata columns (e.g., samples).

title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
text: function performs following steps: Validates existence provided CDT. Reads metadata (sheet 3) row data (sheet 2) CDT file. Extracts assay data based specified data_type. Cleans formats metadata row data. componds kept ones non-NA value selected row data (annotation) column. Ensures consistency metadata assay data dimensions. Constructs SummarizedExperiment object. Optionally saves resulting object file save_file TRUE.

title: Convert CDT File to SummarizedExperiment Object — cdt_to_se
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Convert a CDT file to a SummarizedExperiment object se <- cdt_to_se(   cdt = "path/to/cdt_file.xlsx",   save_file = FALSE,   data_type = "log_transformed" ) } # }

what: Prepare results for Metabolon upload — make_results_for_metabolon
title: Prepare results for Metabolon upload — make_results_for_metabolon
text: function transforms results tables (limma, DESeq2, custom formats) format compatible Metabolon multi-omics module.

title: Prepare results for Metabolon upload — make_results_for_metabolon
Prepare results for Metabolon upload — make_results_for_metabolon
text: table data frame containing results differential expression analysis. format character string specifying format input table. Options "topTable" (limma), "DESeqResults" (DESeq2), "edgeR" (yet supported), "Custom". Default "topTable". omics character string specifying type omics data. Default "transcriptomics". custom_colnames character vector specifying custom column names "Custom" format. Must include least "p-value", "FDR", "FC". Default NULL.

title: Prepare results for Metabolon upload — make_results_for_metabolon
text: data frame formatted Metabolon, columns: Feature, Omics, p-value, FDR, FC.

Clean and format the row data from the CDT file — make_rowdata
text: rowdata data frame containing row data CDT file. rowdata_key character string specifying column name use row names.

title: Clean and format the row data from the CDT file — make_rowdata
text: cleaned formatted row data data frame.

what: Convert Results to Metabolon Format. — results_to_metabolon
title: Convert Results to Metabolon Format. — results_to_metabolon
text: function converts results table format compatible Metabolon data analysis.

title: Convert Results to Metabolon Format. — results_to_metabolon
code: results_to_metabolon(   table,   format = "topTable",   omics = "Transcriptomics",   custom_colnames = NULL,   output_file = NULL,   save_file = TRUE )

title: Convert Results to Metabolon Format. — results_to_metabolon
text: table data frame containing results converted. format character string specifying format input results. Options "DESeqResults" (default) "topTable". omics character string specifying type omics data. Options "Transcriptomics" (default) "Proteomics". custom_colnames optional character vector specifying custom column names output. NULL, default column names used. output_file character string specifying path save output file. NULL save_file TRUE, default filename generated. Needs csv! save_file logical value indicating whether save output file. Default TRUE.

title: Convert Results to Metabolon Format. — results_to_metabolon
text: data frame formatted according standard required Metabolon.

title: Convert Results to Metabolon Format. — results_to_metabolon
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ # Convert DESeqResults to Metabolon format results_metabolon <- results_to_metabolon(   table = deseq_results,   format = "DESeqResults",   omics = "Transcriptomics",   input_features = "gene_symbol",   save_file = TRUE ) } # }

what: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
title: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
text: function converts SummarizedExperiment object format compatible Metabolon data analysis.

title: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
code: se_to_metabolon(   se,   cdt,   output_file = NULL,   save_file = TRUE,   sample_id_column = NULL )

title: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
text: se SummarizedExperiment object containing assay data. cdt character string specifying path client data table path. output_file character string specifying path save output file. NULL save_file TRUE, default filename generated saved working directory. save_file logical value indicating whether save output file. Needs csv! Default TRUE. sample_id_column character string specifying column name colData contains sample IDs matching PARENT_SAMPLE_NAME names. Default NULL.

title: Convert SummarizedExperiment to Metabolon Format — se_to_metabolon
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ se <- SummarizedExperiment::SummarizedExperiment() result <- se_to_metabolon(se, cdt = "cdt.xlsx", input_features = "gene_symbol", save_file = TRUE) } # }
